title: Mathematics Classroom Discussion Design for Real-Life Problem Solving

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic arithmetic operations and geometric concepts
context.additional_context: Strengthening mathematical discussion skills for solving social domain job-related problems among practicing professionals

learning_goals: Learners can transform real-life social issues into mathematical models and propose at least three solution strategies in discussions
Learners can provide feedback that advances discussion content by actively listening to peers and applying critical thinking
Learners can analyze solutions derived from discussions using quantitative data and apply them to decision-making with over 80% accuracy
Learners can visualize and share discussion processes using digital tools (calculators, collaboration apps, etc.) in a BYOD environment

resources: BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) Compatible Software

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
